title: Demon Slayer

The wiki defaults to the British convention for floor numbering: Ground floor, first floor, etc. This may be changed by clicking the moon icon at the top right of the site.
This quest has a quick guide found here.
It briefly summarises the steps needed to complete the quest.
Demon Slayer (#2)
Released 4 January 2001 (Update)
Members No
Quest series Demon Slayer
Official difficulty Novice
Lead developer(s) Paul Gower

A mighty demon is being summoned to destroy the city of Varrock. You find out you are the one destined to stop him (or at least try).

Contents

  • 1 Details
  • 2 Walkthrough
    • 2.1 Getting started
    • 2.2 Captain Rovin's key
    • 2.3 Wizard Traiborn's key
    • 2.4 Sir Prysin's key
    • 2.5 Banishing Delrith
  • 3 Rewards
  • 4 Required for completing
  • 5 Transcript
  • 6 Changes
  • 7 Trivia

Details[edit | edit source]

Start point Speak to the Gypsy in the tent on the western side of Varrock Square.
Official difficultyNovice
DescriptionA mighty demon is being summoned to destroy the city of Varrock. You find out you are the one destined to stop him (or at least try).
Official lengthShort
Requirements The ability to defeat a level 27 demon aided by three level 20 Dark wizards and two level 7 Dark wizards using the Silverlight in melee.
Items required
  • Bucket of water (can be obtained during the quest)
  • 25 bones (can't be noted, but can be delivered in increments)
  • 1 coin
Recommended
  • 15 Combat level
  • Armour and some food
  • Fast travel to Varrock (Varrock teleport, Chronicle or (members only) Combat Bracelet to the Champions' Guild)
  • (Members only) Fast travel to the Wizards' Tower (Necklace of Passage or Amulet of Glory to Draynor Village)
Enemies to defeat Delrith (level 27)
{"requirements":"The ability to defeat a level 27 [[Delrith|demon]] aided by three level 20 [[Dark wizard]]s and two level 7 Dark wizards using the [[Silverlight]] in melee.","desc":"A mighty demon is being summoned to destroy the city of Varrock. You find out you are the one destined to stop him (or at least try).","difficulty":"Novice","kills":"[[Delrith]] ''(level 27)''","name":"Demon Slayer","start":"Speak to the [[Gypsy Aris|Gypsy]] in the tent on the western side of [[Varrock Square]].","length":"Short","items":"*[[Bucket of water]] (can be obtained during the quest)\n*25 [[bones]] (can't be [[noted]], but can be delivered in increments)\n*1 [[coin]]"}

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

Getting started[edit | edit source]

Items required: 3 empty inventory spaces, 1 gold coin.

Wally slaying Delrith.
Wally's Theme
The music which plays while the Gypsy describes Wally's victory.

Speak to the Gypsy in the tent on the western side of Varrock Square. Pay her one coin, and she will tell you a story involving a demon named Delrith. The demon is being summoned again, and you have to kill him. Ask her, "So, how did Wally kill the demon?" Write down or screenshot what Wally says as it will be important later on. The word order of this spell is randomised per player. She tells you to talk to Sir Prysin to help.

Go north to Varrock Castle. Sir Prysin will be wandering the south-west portion of the ground floor[UK]1st floor[US] of the castle. Talk to him and tell him that the Gypsy sent you. Ask for Silverlight, the weapon needed to kill Delrith. He will say that he kept it hidden because of it being so powerful and it needs three keys to open it. He will tell you that he lost his key somewhere, and the other two keys are in the possession of Captain Rovin and the Wizard Traiborn.

Captain Rovin's key[edit | edit source]

One of the keys may be obtained by speaking to Captain Rovin, who is found on the 2nd floor[UK]3rd floor[US] on the north-west side of the palace. Climb up the stairs in the north-west room twice in order to reach him.

Talk to him and tell him that you need the key in order to recover Silverlight, as a demon is going to invade the city, and that Sir Prysin mentioned that he would give the key to you. He will rant about the King being the only one to tell him what to do. Following this ask him why did Sir Prysin give it to you then. He'll state the king made him so he wouldn't lose it then hand over the key to you under the condition that you do not allow Sir Prysin to kill the demon.

Wizard Traiborn casts a spell to summon a wardrobe containing his key

Wizard Traiborn's key[edit | edit source]

Items required: 25 unnoted bones.

Talk to Traiborn about some keys knocking around. He is located on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of the Wizards' Tower, south of Draynor Village. Traiborn requires 25 regular bones for his spell. You can save time by having all of the bones with you when you first speak to him. An easy way to get the bones is to kill goblins south of the prison outside of Draynor Village. Give Traiborn the bones, and he will perform a ritual. When he's done with his ritual, he will give you his key.

Note for Ultimate Ironmen: You can deliver the bones in increments, so you do not need to clear out your inventory to complete this step.

Sir Prysin's key[edit | edit source]

Items required: bucket of water.

Head back to Varrock palace.

Go into the kitchen located in the north-east corner of the ground floor[UK]1st floor[US]. If you do not already have a bucket of water, you can find an empty bucket up the stairs and in the bedroom to the north-east. Grab the bucket, go back down the stairs, and use the bucket on the sink in the kitchen or in a fountain to obtain a bucket of water. Next, head outside the kitchen door and look for a drain near the wall north of the doorway. Use your bucket of water on the drain. If you do not do this, you cannot obtain the key. The key will be washed down the drain into the sewer. Head east out of the palace, and look for a manhole located south of the palace's east walls. It is marked by the icon on the minimap. Open and climb down the manhole.

The path to Sir Prysin's key in the sewers

Now, go north-west and follow the path highlighted on the map above until you reach a stream. You should see a muddy patch to your left, next to a pile of skeletons. Examine this and you will find a rusty key.

Banishing Delrith[edit | edit source]

Items Recommended: food and armour.

Now that you have all three keys, head back to Sir Prysin in Varrock. Give him the three keys, and he will give you Silverlight. Players can drop Silverlight and ask Sir Prysin for another one for free; after the quest he will charge 500 coins. Equip it and get any food and armour you may need for combat.

If you have forgotten the magical incantation, you can speak with Gypsy Aris at her tent in Varrock Square to hear them again. Take note of the incantation words - it is different per player.

The dark wizards attempt to summon Delrith!

If you are ready, head south of Varrock and then east towards the stone circle surrounded by dark wizards. A cutscene of Delrith being summoned by the wizards is shown after first entering the circle for the final part of the quest.

Delrith is summoned!
Danger Ahead
The music which plays when Delrith is summoned.

The final part takes place in an instance of the Varrock stone circle, with Delrith and several dark wizards. To leave, run to the edge. Level 7 and 20 wizards will be aggressive to players with lower than 14 or 40 combat level, respectively. Their maximum hit of 6 can threaten players with a low Hitpoints level, especially if the player has negative Magic Defence bonus.

Because the fight takes place in a single-way combat zone, if you are already under attack from a dark wizard, you will need to kill or hide from the attacking wizard before you are able to begin combat with Delrith. It is recommended for lower level players to approach from the south to hide from wizards behind the southernmost stone wall until Delrith is nearby. Ring of recoils can be used.

Attack Delrith with Silverlight equipped. Despite his combat level of 27, the Silverlight's weakening effect will reduce Delrith's hitpoints to less than that of a cow. When he reaches 0 hitpoints, say the magical incantation. If the wrong incantation is said, Delrith regenerates to full health.

Alternatively, for non-melee pures with magic, players can wield Silverlight and manual cast spells to quickly finish-off Delrith. Other methods, include flinching Delrith or, for low-levelled mages, using Confuse, Curse, or Weaken to make him easier to kill with melee.

If you take too long, Delrith will disappear and you will need to leave and re-enter the instance, so use whatever you can to remember the incantation before the fight. However, if Delrith disappears during the dialogue to banish him the quest can still be completed by pressing "continue" until the end.

Congratulations! Quest complete!

Rewards[edit | edit source]

  • 3 Quest points
  • Silverlight (if lost, players may retrieve it from Sir Prysin for a fee of 500 coins. It can also be sold to the Wise Old Man for 80 coins.)
  • Completing this quest awards the player with 5 Kudos which can be claimed by talking to Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum

Required for completing[edit | edit source]

Completion of Demon Slayer is required for the following:

  • Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Lumbridge Guide
  • Shadow of the Storm

Transcript[edit | edit source]

This article on a quest has an associated dialogue page.
Click here for a transcript of possible conversations encountered throughout the quest.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
29 November 2018
(update)

Silverlight obtained at the beginning of Shadow of the Storm can no longer be used to complete the quest.


Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Demon Slayer is one of 6 quests released on the launch day of RuneScape.

==Walkthrough==
===Getting started===
'''''Items required''': 3 empty inventory spaces, 1 gold coin.''
[[File:Demon Slayer - Wally.png|thumb|220px|[[Wally]] slaying Delrith.]]
{{Listen
|title = Wally's Theme
|desc = The music which plays while the Gypsy describes Wally's victory.
|filename = Wally's Theme.ogg
}}

Speak to the [[Gypsy Aris|Gypsy]] in the tent on the western side of [[Varrock Square]]. Pay her one [[coin]], and she will tell you a story involving a [[demon]] named [[Delrith]]. The demon is being summoned again, and you have to kill him. Ask her, ''"So, how did Wally kill the demon?"'' Write down or screenshot what [[Wally]] says as it will be important later on. '''The word order of this spell is randomised per player.''' She tells you to talk to [[Sir Prysin]] to help.

Go north to [[Varrock Castle]]. [[Sir Prysin]] will be wandering the south-west portion of the {{FloorNumber|uk=0}} of the castle. Talk to him and tell him that the Gypsy sent you. Ask for [[Silverlight]], the weapon needed to kill Delrith. He will say that he kept it hidden because of it being so powerful and it needs three keys to open it. He will tell you that he lost his key somewhere, and the other two keys are in the possession of [[Captain Rovin]] and the Wizard [[Traiborn]].

===Captain Rovin's key===
One of the keys may be obtained by speaking to [[Captain Rovin]], who is found on the {{FloorNumber|uk=2}} on the north-west side of the palace. Climb up the stairs in the north-west room twice in order to reach him.

Talk to him and tell him that you need the key in order to recover [[Silverlight]], as a demon is going to invade the city, and that Sir Prysin mentioned that he would give the key to you. He will rant about the King being the only one to tell him what to do. Following this ask him why did Sir Prysin give it to you then. He'll state the king made him so he wouldn't lose it then hand over the key to you under the condition that you do not allow Sir Prysin to kill the demon.

[[File:Demon Slayer - Wizard Traiborn's wardrobe.gif|thumb|250px|Wizard Traiborn casts a spell to summon a wardrobe containing his key]]

===Wizard Traiborn's key===
'''''Items required:''' 25 unnoted [[bones]].''

Talk to [[Traiborn]] about some keys knocking around. He is located on the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} of the [[Wizards' Tower]], south of [[Draynor Village]]. Traiborn requires 25 regular [[bones]] for his spell. You can save time by having all of the bones with you when you first speak to him. An easy way to get the bones is to kill goblins south of the prison outside of Draynor Village. Give Traiborn the bones, and he will perform a ritual. When he's done with his ritual, he will give you his key.

Note for [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] Ultimate Ironmen: You can deliver the bones in increments, so you do not need to clear out your inventory to complete this step.

===Sir Prysin's key===
'''''Items required:''' [[bucket of water]].''

Head back to Varrock palace.

Go into the kitchen located in the north-east corner of the {{FloorNumber|uk=0}}. If you do not already have a [[bucket of water]], you can find an empty [[bucket]] up the stairs and in the bedroom to the north-east. Grab the bucket, go back down the stairs, and use the bucket on the sink in the kitchen or in a fountain to obtain a bucket of water.
Next, head outside the kitchen door and look for a drain near the wall north of the doorway. Use your bucket of water on the drain. '''If you do not do this, you cannot obtain the key'''. The key will be washed down the drain into the [[Varrock Sewers|sewer]]. Head east out of the palace, and look for a manhole located south of the palace's east walls. It is marked by the [[File:Dungeon icon.png]] icon on the [[minimap]]. Open and climb down the manhole.

[[File:Demon Slayer - Sewer map.png|frame|centre|The path to Sir Prysin's key in the sewers]]
Now, go north-west and follow the path highlighted on the map above until you reach a stream. You should see a muddy patch to your left, next to a pile of skeletons. Examine this and you will find a rusty key.

===Banishing Delrith===
'''''Items Recommended:''' [[food]] and [[armour]].''

Now that you have all three keys, head back to [[Sir Prysin]] in Varrock. Give him the three keys, and he will give you [[Silverlight]]. Players can drop Silverlight and ask Sir Prysin for another one for free; after the quest he will charge 500 coins. Equip it and get any [[food]] and [[armour]] you may need for combat.

If you have forgotten the magical incantation, you can speak with Gypsy Aris at her tent in Varrock Square to hear them again. '''Take note of the incantation words - it is different per player.'''

[[File:Demon Slayer - Summoning ritual.png|thumb|220px|The dark wizards attempt to summon Delrith!]]
If you are ready, head south of [[Varrock]] and then east towards the stone circle surrounded by [[dark wizard]]s. A cutscene of [[Delrith]] being summoned by the wizards is shown after first entering the circle for the final part of the quest.
[[File:Demon Slayer - Delrith is summoned.png|thumb|220px|Delrith is summoned!]]
{{Listen
|title = Danger Ahead
|desc = The music which plays when Delrith is summoned.
|filename = Danger Ahead.ogg
}}

The final part takes place in an instance of the [[Varrock]] [[stone circle]], with Delrith and several dark wizards. To leave, run to the edge. Level 7 and 20 wizards will be [[aggressive]] to players with lower than 14 or 40 [[combat level]], respectively. Their maximum hit of 6 can threaten players with a low [[Hitpoints]] level, especially if the player has negative [[Magic Defence]] bonus.

Because the fight takes place in a [[single-way combat]] zone, if you are already under attack from a dark wizard, you will need to kill or hide from the attacking wizard before you are able to begin combat with Delrith. It is recommended for lower level players to approach from the south to hide from wizards behind the southernmost stone wall until Delrith is nearby. [[Ring of recoil]]s can be used.

Attack Delrith with Silverlight equipped. Despite his combat level of 27, the Silverlight's weakening effect will reduce Delrith's hitpoints to less than that of a [[cow]]. When he reaches 0 hitpoints, say the magical incantation. If the wrong incantation is said, Delrith regenerates to full health. 

''Alternatively, for non-melee pures with magic, players can wield Silverlight and manual cast spells to quickly finish-off Delrith.'' Other methods, include [[flinch|flinching]] Delrith or, for low-levelled mages, using [[Confuse]], [[Curse]], or [[Weaken]] to make him easier to kill with melee.

If you take too long, [[Delrith]] will disappear and you will need to leave and re-enter the instance, so use whatever you can to remember the incantation before the fight. However, if Delrith disappears during the dialogue to banish him the quest can still be completed by pressing "continue" until the end.

'''Congratulations! Quest complete!'''
